intro: Dryandra uncata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dryandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to Western Australia and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 2 meters, with woody stems and small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
